block.p: The patron saint of Champagne, St. Vincent, will be honored on his day tomorrow with numerous festivities in France. Here in New York, the French Institute-Alliance Francaise will do its part by naming the winner of a contest in which participants will be tested on their knowledge of Champagne. Five regional finalists, who were selected from more than 2,000 entrants, will be quizzed by judges from 5:30 to 6:30 P.M. at the French Institute, 22 East 60th Street. The public may attend, at no charge, and drink free Champagne.

The patron saint of Champagne, St. Vincent, will be honored on his day tomorrow with numerous festivities in France. Here in New York, the French Institute-Alliance Francaise will do its part by naming the winner of a contest in which participants will be tested on their knowledge of Champagne. Five regional finalists, who were selected from more than 2,000 entrants, will be quizzed by judges from 5:30 to 6:30 P.M. at the French Institute, 22 East 60th Street. The public may attend, at no charge, and drink free Champagne.
Also to honor St. Vincent, Champagnes will be sold from 10 P.M. to 4 A.M. at Chaos, 23 Watts Street (West Broadway).
Celebrating the Year of the Tiger

The Chinese New Year -- this will be the Year of the Tiger -- will begin Jan. 28. On Sunday, Adventures on a Shoestring, an organization that runs walking tours, has scheduled four tours of the food and cultural highlights of Manhattan's Chinatown, at 11 A.M. and at 1, 3 and 5 P.M. Each tour is $5 and includes an optional Chinese meal, for $8 more. For information and reservations: (212) 265-2663.
Starting Tuesday, many of the city's Chinese restaurants will be holding banquets for the New Year, often with the traditional lion dances. It's not too early to reserve.
